result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant David L Lefler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fines/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office.  Payment plan of $25.00 per month beginning October 1, 2015, and due on the first day of each month thereafter.
Must pay DNA surcharge of $250.00 - does not need to provide DNA sample.
Absolute Sobriety.  Subject to testing to determine compliance.

timeConds.notes: Conditional time banked for the use of Probation if necessary.
12.5 hours of community service to be completed during each year of probation for a total of 25 hours.
